fields.summary: getBlockLocations() does not resolve the .reserved path and generates incorrect edit logs when updating the atime

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description: That's because in getBlockLocations there is a gap between readUnlock and re-fetch write lock (to update access time). If a rename operation occurs in the gap, the update of access time will be ignored. We can calculate new path from the inode and use the new path to update access time.Â
fields.summary: INode access time is ignored because of race between open and rename
